parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The value of the meta tag's name attribute.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The value of the meta tag's content attribute.

methods.name: addMetaTag(name, content)
methods.description:
Adds a meta tag to the page. Meta tags included directly in an Apps Script HTML file are
ignored. Only the following meta tags are allowed:

methods.name: append(addedContent)
methods.description:
Appends new content to the content of thisHtmlOutput. Use this only for content from a
trusted source, because it is not escaped.

methods.name: appendUntrusted(addedContent)
methods.description: Appends new content to the content of thisHtmlOutput, using contextual escaping.

methods.name: asTemplate()
methods.description:
Returns anHtmlTemplatebacked by thisHtmlOutput. This method can be used to
build up a template incrementally. Future changes toHtmlOutputaffect the contents of
theHtmlTemplateas well.

methods.name: clear()
methods.description: Clears the current content.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The MIME type to convert to. For most blobs,'application/pdf'is
    the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of'image/bmp','image/gif','image/jpeg', or'image/png'are also
    valid. For a Google Docs document,'text/markdown'is also valid.

methods.name: getAs(contentType)
methods.description:
Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type. This
method adds the appropriate extension to the filename—for example, "myfile.pdf". However, it
assumes that the part of the filename that follows the last period (if any) is an existing
extension that should be replaced. Consequently, "ShoppingList.12.25.2014" becomes
"ShoppingList.12.25.pdf".

methods.name: getBlob()
methods.description: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

methods.name: getContent()
methods.description: Gets the content of thisHtmlOutput.

methods.name: getFaviconUrl()
methods.description:
Gets the URL for a favicon link tag added to the page by callingsetFaviconUrl(iconUrl). Favicon link tags included directly in an Apps Script HTML file are
ignored.

methods.name: getHeight()
methods.description:
Gets the initial height of thecustom dialogin Google
Docs, Sheets, or Forms. If theHtmlOutputis published as a web app instead, this
method returnsnull. To resize a dialog that is already open, callgoogle.script.host.setHeight(height)in client-side code.

methods.name: getMetaTags()
methods.description:
Gets an array of objects that represent meta tags added to the page by callingaddMetaTag(name, content). Meta tags included directly in an Apps Script HTML file are
ignored.

methods.name: getTitle()
methods.description: Gets the title of the output page. Note that the <title> HTML element is ignored.

methods.name: getWidth()
methods.description:
Gets the initial width of thecustom dialogin Google
Docs, Sheets, or Forms. If theHtmlOutputis published as a web app instead, this
method returnsnull. To resize a dialog that is already open, callgoogle.script.host.setWidth(width)in client-side code.

methods.name: setContent(content)
methods.description: Sets the content of thisHtmlOutput.

parameters.name: iconUrl
parameters.description:
The URL of the favicon image, with the image extension indicating the image
    type.

methods.name: setFaviconUrl(iconUrl)
methods.description:
Adds a link tag for a favicon to the page. Favicon link tags included directly in an Apps
Script HTML file are ignored.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The new height in pixels;nullresults in a default value.

methods.name: setHeight(height)
methods.description:
Sets the initial height of thecustom dialogin Google
Docs, Sheets, or Forms. If theHtmlOutputis published as a web app instead, this
method has no effect. To resize a dialog that is already open, callgoogle.script.host.setHeight(height)in client-side code.

methods.name: setSandboxMode(mode)
methods.description:
This method now has no effect — previously it set thesandbox
modeused for client-side scripts. To protect users from being served malicious HTML or
JavaScript, client-side code served from HTML service executes in a security sandbox that
imposes restrictions on the code. Originally this method allowed script authors to choose
between different versions of the sandbox, but now all scripts now useIFRAMEmode
regardless of what sandbox mode is set. For more information, see theguide to restrictions in HTML service.

methods.name: setTitle(title)
methods.description:
Sets the title of the output page. For web apps, this is the title of the entire page, while
forHtmlOutputshown in Google Sheets, this is the dialog title.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The new width in pixels;nullresults in a default value.

methods.name: setWidth(width)
methods.description:
Sets the initial width of acustom dialogin Google
Docs, Sheets, or Forms. If theHtmlOutputis published as a web app instead, this
method has no effect. To resize a dialog that is already open, callgoogle.script.host.setWidth(width)in client-side code.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The XFrame options mode to set.

methods.name: setXFrameOptionsMode(mode)
methods.description:
Sets the state of the page'sX-Frame-Optionsheader, which controls clickjacking
prevention.

methods.name: getContent()
methods.description: Gets the content of this meta tag.

methods.name: getName()
methods.description: Gets the name of thisHtmlOutputMetaTag.

methods.name: createHtmlOutput()
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlOutputobject that can be returned from the script.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: the object to get HTML out of

methods.name: createHtmlOutput(blob)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlOutputobject from aBlobSourceresource.

methods.name: createHtmlOutput(html)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlOutputobject that can be returned from the script.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: the name of the file to use

methods.name: createHtmlOutputFromFile(filename)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlOutputobject from a file in the code editor.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: The object to get HTML out of.

methods.name: createTemplate(blob)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlTemplateobject from aBlobSourceresource.

methods.name: createTemplate(html)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlTemplateobject that can be returned from the script.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: the name of the file to use

methods.name: createTemplateFromFile(filename)
methods.description: Creates a newHtmlTemplateobject from a file in the code editor.

methods.name: getUserAgent()
methods.description:
Gets the user-agent string for the current browser. Returnsnullfor most script
executions if not used in a web app'sdoGet()ordoPost()function.

methods.name: evaluate()
methods.description:
Evaluates this template and returns anHtmlOutputobject. Any properties set on thisHtmlTemplateobject will be in scope when evaluating. To debug errors in a template,
examine the code using thegetCode()method.

methods.name: getCode()
methods.description:
Generates a string of JavaScript code, based on the template file, that can be evaluated. This
method produces a string of JavaScript code based on the template file. Callingeval(<code>)will return a newHtmlOutputobject with the content of the
template after running all embedded server scripts. The generated code is intended to be
human-readable, and so if you need to debug a template you can callLogger.log(<code>)to see what was produced.

methods.name: getCodeWithComments()
methods.description:
Generates a string of JavaScript code that can be evaluated, with each line of the code
containing the original line from the template as a comment. This method produces a string of
JavaScript code based on the template file. Callingeval(<code>)will return
a newHtmlOutputobject with the content of the template after running all embedded
server scripts. The generated code is intended to be human-readable, and so if you need to
debug a template you can callLogger.log(<code>)to see what was produced.

methods.name: getRawContent()
methods.description: Returns the unprocessed content of this template.

enum_members.name: EMULATED
enum_members.description:
A legacy sandbox mode that emulates ECMAScript 5 strict mode using only the features available
in ECMAScript 3. This mode was the default prior to February 2014.EMULATEDwassunset as of December 10,
2015. All scripts attempting useEMULATEDwill now useIFRAMEinstead.

enum_members.name: IFRAME
enum_members.description:
A sandbox mode that uses iframe sandboxing instead of the Caja sandbox technology used by theEMULATEDandNATIVEmodes. This mode is the default for new scripts as of
November 12, 2015 and for all scripts as of July 6, 2016.This mode imposes many fewer restrictions than the other sandbox modes and runs fastest, but
does not work at all in certain older browsers, including Internet Explorer 9.

enum_members.name: NATIVE
enum_members.description:
A sandbox mode that is built on top of ECMAScript 5 strict mode. A sandbox mode built on top of
ECMAScript 5 strict mode. This mode wassunset as
of July 6, 2016. All scripts now useIFRAMEmode.

enum_members.name: ALLOWALL
enum_members.description:
NoX-Frame-Optionsheader will be set. This will let any site iframe the page, so the
developer should implement their own protection against clickjacking.

enum_members.name: DEFAULT
enum_members.description:
Sets the default value for theX-Frame-Optionsheader, which preserves normal security
assumptions. If a script does not set anX-Frame-Optionsmode, Apps Script uses this
mode as the default.
